text: Bartholomew I (, Patriarchis Bartholomaios A' , ; born 29 February 1940) is the Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople, since 2 November 1991. He is the "first among equals" in the Eastern Orthodox Communion, and the spiritual leader of 300 million Orthodox Christians around the world.Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew: insights into an Orthodox Christian worldview (2007) John Chryssavgis International Journal of Environmental Studies, 64, (1);pp: 9 - 18 == Contributor == Bartholomew wrote a chapter with Pope John Paul II in “Earth Toward Our Children’s Future". He wrote an essay, "To Commit a Crime Against the Natural World Is a Sin” in Moral Ground: Ethical Action for a Planet in Peril (Trinity University Press, 2010 ). ==Related pages== *Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople *Ecumenism *Mount Athos *Orthodox Church == References == Category:1940 births Category:Living people Patriarch Bartholomew I of Constantinople Category:Patriarchs Category:Turkish Christian clergy
